channel.title: Having troubles with my server
channel.description: well i have my client.. its ip is set to 127.0.0.1 or w.e and when i log in i can play but when i go to change to my ip in my no-ip that i made it wont let me connect. and its an active ip too..

item.title: Having troubles with my server
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you use a modem, or multiple routers, you can use your no-ip. If not, than you must use localhost or a connection cannot be made.

Read full topic

item.title: Having troubles with my server
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Make sure you port forward, plus i never have to use 127.0.0.1 for my client.

Read full topic

item.title: Having troubles with my server
item.dc:creator: @skatersscape skatersscape
item.description:
@skatersscape wrote:

wait what are you having trouble with making the no-ip work or making your actual ip work?

You cannot use a no-ip address to long into your own server. You have to use 127.0.0.1 as long as you host, other people use the no-ip.

Not true, My client has the no-ip and I log on with no problem. You have to portforward still if you use the no-ip (im pretty sure but not 100% positive).

Read full topic
